title: Min County
text:
Min County or Minxian is administratively under the control of the <a href="prefecture-level%20city">prefecture-level city</a> of <a href="Dingxi">Dingxi</a>, in the south of <a href="Gansu">Gansu</a> province, China. In ancient times, it was known as <a href="Lintao">Lintao</a> County due to its location along the <a href="Tao%20River">Tao River</a>. It was founded as Minzhou (岷州) in 544, named after the <a href="Min%20Mountains">Min Mountains</a> in the south of the county. The county received its present name in 1913. In 1985 it became subordinate to Dingxi. Min county is well known by <a href="Angelica%20sinensis">Angelica sinensis</a> () which is a Chinese traditional medicine.
Administrative divisions.
Min County is divided to 15 towns and 3 townships.
